topic.title: Adding an IP Address to a Data Interface
topic.shortdesc: You can add IP addresses to a data interface using the web administration interface or the command line.

body.p: For VXLAN connectivity between VMs, you must add appropriate endpoint IP addresses to the compute node interfaces.
To add an IP address using the web administration interface, refer to the following steps. To use the command-line interface; see
To make interface changes, you must lock the compute host first.

ol.li:
Set the interface to support an IPv4 or IPv6 address, or both.
On the Admin menu, click Inventory to open the System Inventory page.
Select the Host tab, and then double-click the compute host to open the Host Detail page.
Click Edit Interface for the data interface you want to edit.
In the Edit Interface dialog box, set the IPv4 Addressing Mode or the IPv6 Addressing Mode to Static.
TiS Edit Interface, IPv4 Static

Add an IPv4 or IPv6 address to the interface.
On the Inventory Detail page, click the Name of the interface to open the Interface Detail page.
TiS Interface Detail page
Click Create Address to open the Create Address dialog box.
TiS Create Address
Enter the IPv4 or IPv6 address and netmask (for example, 192.168.1.3/24), and then click Create Address.
The new address is added to the Address List.
Unlock the compute node and wait for it to become available.
